bwwExcerpt: In a second viewing of this National Theatre of Scotland production, Cumming is even more verbally dexterous and dynamic...Directors John Tiffany and Andrew Goldberg layer the production with spooky sounds and moody music and keep Cumming on the move...Even with all that, this solo stab at the Bard ...
showScoreExcerpt:
"One does wonder why Macbeth looks like he’s been at a fashion shoot when he’s supposedly just back from a battle. And as directed, his big speeches turn repetitious. In the end, this 'Macbeth' is a star-enhanced hodgepodge. It’s filled with some sound, some fury, and many question marks."
